explanation: The original line used float division int(x/y)+1 which both risks precision errors for very large integers and gives an off-by-one when x is exactly divisible by y. I replaced it with an integer ceiling division formula (x + y - 1) // y which computes the minimal number of attacks using only integer arithmetic. (No retrieved diff directly applied here; the fix is the standard integer ceiling division.)
fixed_code:
x, y = map(int, input().split())
print((x + y - 1) // y)
